description: Base -2 representation for n regarded as base 2, then evaluated.
comments: a(n) = n when n is a power of 4. This is because the even-indexed powers of 2 are the same as the even-indexed powers of -2. - _Alonso del Arte_, Feb 09 2012a(n) = n if n is a sum of distinct powers of 4. - _Michael Somos_, Aug 27 2012
references: M. Gardner, Knotted Doughnuts and Other Mathematical Entertainments. Freeman, NY, 1986, p. 101.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
